sentences.en: A factory stands gutted and deserted.
sentences.cn: 一座内部被毁的废置工厂矗立在那里。

sentences.en: At the edge of the desert, he came across a deserted church.
sentences.cn: 在沙漠的边缘地带，他碰巧发现了一个被遗弃的教堂。

sentences.en: Courage seems now to have deserted him. May it quickly reappear.
sentences.cn: 他现在似乎失去了勇气，但愿他能很快重新振作起来。

sentences.en: He deserted from army intelligence last month.
sentences.cn: 上个月他从陆军情报机关开小差跑了。

sentences.en: He often had to spend the night in deserted temples.
sentences.cn: 他常常不得不在清冷的庙中过夜.

sentences.en: He was a second-lieutenant in the army until he deserted.
sentences.cn: 他在擅离部队之前是一名陆军少尉。

sentences.en: His muse had deserted him, and he could no longer write.
sentences.cn: 他已无灵感, 不能再写作了.

sentences.en: I could see no sign of life in the deserted town.
sentences.cn: 在这个无人居住的城镇,我看不见一点生命的迹象.

sentences.en: Ingrid darted across the deserted street.
sentences.cn: 英格丽德飞奔过空无一人的街道。

sentences.en: Poor farmers are deserting their parched farm fields and coming here looking for jobs.
sentences.cn: 贫穷的农民丢下干旱的农田，来这里寻找工作。

sentences.en: She found her customary self-possession had deserted her.
sentences.cn: 她发现自己不像平时那样处事不惊了。

sentences.en: She had the look of someone deserted and betrayed.
sentences.cn: 她一副遭人遗弃和背叛的样子。

sentences.en: She led them into a deserted sidestreet.
sentences.cn: 她带着他们走进一条空寂无人的小巷。

sentences.en: The criminals went to ground in a deserted old farm house.
sentences.cn: 罪犯们逃到一间废弃的破旧农舍中躲藏起来.

sentences.en: The deserted village was filled with a deathly silence.
sentences.cn: 这个荒废的村庄死一般的寂静.

sentences.en: The enemy chieftain was opposed and deserted by his followers.
The house seemed muted, hushed as if it had been deserted.
sentences.cn: 房子里似乎悄然无声，安静得好像已经没人在住一样。

sentences.en: The old mine now stands completely deserted .
sentences.cn: 那座旧矿现在完全废弃了。

words.tran_cn: 逃兵；背弃者；[劳经] 擅离职守者；脱党者

phrases.tran_cn: 阿塔卡马沙漠（位于智利北部）
n. 冻原；寒冷不毛之地
沙漠风暴（指1990年以美国为首的多国部队针对伊拉克侵占科威特而发动的军事进攻）
戈壁沙漠（蒙古和中国西北部）
喀拉哈里沙漠（位于非洲南部）
纳米布沙漠（位于非洲西南部，是世界上最古老、最干燥的沙漠之一）
塔克拉玛干沙漠（新疆塔里木盆地中部）

trans.tran_cn: （ 地方） 无人居住的，空寂无人的，被抛弃的，被遗弃的
trans.tran_en: a wife etc who has been left by her husband etc

trans.tran_cn: 舍弃( desert的过去式和过去分词 )，废弃，（在需要时刻）背离，擅离（职守、工作岗位、现役等）
trans.tran_en: If people or animals desert a place, they leave it and it becomes empty
